intro: Brassica washitana, commonly known as the desert mustard, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops like broccoli and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately compound leaves. It is adapted to survive in harsh environments with limited water availability. Brassica washitana plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for wildlife in its native habitat.
